sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: What is the area of a sector of a circle with radius 8cm and central angle of 60 degrees?
message_2:
To find the area of a sector of a circle, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle / 360) × π × r²

where r is the radius of the circle and the central angle is in degrees.

In this case, the radius (r) is 8 cm and the central angle is 60 degrees.

Area of sector = (60 / 360) × π × 8²

Area of sector = (1/6) × π × 64

Area of sector = 64π/6

Area of sector = 32π/3

The area of the sector is (32π/3) square centimeters.
